intro: Synaedrys, commonly known as the ghost orchid, is a rare and enigmatic flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, pale green or white, leafless stems that often resemble ghostly shapes. The plant produces small, fragrant, white flowers that bloom in late summer, adding to its ethereal appearance. Synaedrys thrives in specific wetland habitats, often growing on the trunks of trees or in swampy areas.
